thread.title: G2 Intelligence and Arizona State University's International School of Biomedical Diagnostics Announce Diagnostic Research and Education Alliance
thread.title_full: G2 Intelligence and Arizona State University's International School of Biomedical Diagnostics Announce Diagnostic Research and Education Alliance

title: G2 Intelligence and Arizona State University's International School of Biomedical Diagnostics Announce Diagnostic Research and Education Alliance
text:
RSS Navigation Links HOME >> BIOLOGY >> TECHNOLOGY G2 Intelligence and Arizona State University's International School of Biomedical Diagnostics Announce Diagnostic Research and Education Alliance ... WASHINGTON Oct. 16 2015 /- Ar...Photo - Inter... We are very pleased with the opportunity to work together with G2 Int... http://feeds.bio-medicine.org/latest-biology-technology Date:10/16/2015 
WASHINGTON , Oct. 16, 2015 /PRNewswire/ -- Arizona State University's International School of Biomedical Diagnostics and G2 Intelligence, a division of Plain Language Media, LLLP, today announced a new research, publishing and distribution alliance to advance the scientific study and real-world commercialization of the diagnostic industry. 
Photo - http://photos.prnewswire.com/prnh/20151015/277559 
The partnership between ASU's International School of Biomedical Diagnostics and New London, Connecticut -based G2 Intelligence , one of the leading information service providers in the diagnostics industry, includes applied research initiatives, industry education, training initiatives and jointly-planned and -programmed conferences and events. The partnership was announced at G2 Intelligence's 33 rd annual Lab Institute conference, convening in Washington, DC , Oct. 14-16, 2015. 
"We are very pleased with the opportunity to work together with G2 Intelligence to further develop our relationships with experts and leaders in biomedical diagnostics. One of our first initiatives is to build the industry's most comprehensive knowledge database," said George Runger , Director of ASU's International School of Biomedical Diagnostics. 
The effort capitalizes on ASU's internationally recognized educational programs in Biomedical Diagnostics as well as Informatics and on G2 Intelligence's long-standing connections with and service to the key leaders, lab organizations and service providers in the biomedical diagnostics universe. 
"This research and education alliance will enable the School's programs, ideas and graduates to impact the marketplace faster than ever," said Mara Aspinall , industry veteran and co-founder of ASU's International School of Biomedical Diagnostics. "This is another example of how our School is uniquely positioned to identify, train and educate the next generation of leadership in healthcare, specifically within the diagnostics industry," Aspinall added. 
"This collaboration is a wonderful opportunity to bring together G2 Intelligence's leadership roles in diagnostic business information and research with ASU's tremendous research capabilities and scientific expertise," said Mark Ziebarth , G2 Intelligence's president. 
About the International School of Biomedical Diagnostics at Arizona State University: Arizona State University (ASU), the largest public research university in the U.S., together with Dublin City University (DCU), a world-class leader in biomedicine and diagnostics, created the International School of Biomedical Diagnostics. The School will infuse the industry with skilled workers prepared to boost innovation through the emerging field of biomedical diagnostics. 
About G2 Intelligence: G2 Intelligence, a division of Plain Language Media LLLP, is a leading business information service provider to the diagnostics industry. G2 has been providing industry with news, analysis, context and research solutions, as well as customer-facing conferences and events, for more than 30 years.
